Yusuke
deck: Yusuke Urameshi is the main character from the manga/anime Yu Yu Hakusho. Yusuke is a middle school student and is the Spirit Detective of Earth.
description:
Spirit Detective Saga

Yusuke is a 14 year old boy that goes to Sarayashiki Junior High School. One day while skipping school, Yusuke is walking around the neighborhood and starts entertaining a little boy but the boy wanders into the street, in front of a oncoming car. Yusuke pushes the boy out of the way and gets struck by the car and killed. As a ghost, Yusuke runs into a young girl named Botan, who is a Grim Reaper. She tells Yusuke that if he didn't push the kid out of the way that the kid would have only got a bruise on his arm. She says she can get his life back, but he declines.

This changes once he visits his wake, where people pay their condolences to his mother. Atsuko, his mother is really depressed about her son dying. Keiko Yukimura, a childhood friend cries uncontrollably, screaming Yusuke's name. Kuwabara appears, a somewhat rival of Yusuke's, mad and sad that he died before they could finish all of their battles. Two of his teachers disparage Yusuke at the wake; Mr. Takenaka, also a teacher, scolds them for insulting him. He pays his respects to Atsuko and cries at Yusuke's death; only then, Yusuke's mom reacts, bursting into tears when she hears about them talking about Yusuke. Lastly, the child who Yusuke saved appears with his mother. The boy asks if he can play with Yusuke again, his mother cries and then hugs him. Knowing now that he meant more to others than he realized, Yusuke decides he wants to be alive again.

Yusuke is given a egg by Koenma, lord of Spirit World, and is told that it will hatch a spirit beast. The Spirit beast will help him get his life back, but he has to be be a good person. If he is evil, the beast will devour his soul when it hatches. Yusuke tells Keiko in her dreams that he will be coming back to life. He tells her that his body needs be taken care of so he can return to it.

This proves be hard when an arsonist starts a fire in Yusuke's home and his body is still in there. Keiko decides to run into the fire to protect his body, but almost passes out, even with help from Kuwabara. Yusuke sacrifices the egg to save her. Impressed with his selflessness, Koenma lets Yusuke return to his body without the beast. This can only happen if someone who wants him back gives him some life energy with a kiss, which Keiko manages to do.

After he returns, Yusuke notices that a demon is possessing a person's body. Botan then arrives to tell Yusuke that his experience with death gave him this ability and more. He is now Earth's Spirit Detective, and is now supposed to protect the human race from demons.

As Spirit Detective, he is now assigned with a mission. First, he has to recover three stolen artifacts from the Spirit World. Koenma first trains Yusuke by teaching how to fire his spirit energy. Humans and spirits can use this energy as a weapon. This becomes Yusuke's signature move, the Spirit Gun. Yusuke tries to combat the three thieves. First is Hiei, who stole the Sword of Shadows. Next Kurama, who stole a mirror called the Forlorn Hope. Last is Goki, who stole a soul-stealing article called the Orb of Bast.

Yusuke, with help from Botan, defeated Gouki with his Spirit Gun. When he confronts Kurama, Kurama voluntarily turns over the Forlorn Hope since he only wanted to use its power to save the life of his mother. Kurama wanted to sacrifice his life for the mirror so he can save his mother's, but Yusuke selflessly asked

the mirror to take his own life so Kurama can be with his mother. The mirror granted Kurama's wish and spared both of their lives, and Yusuke took the mirror. Yusuke, with Botan, then went go to fight Hiei, who kidnapped Keiko so he can turn her into a demon. While Botan fought off the transformation, Yusuke outmaneuvered the super fast demon by using his Spirit Gun to bounce off the Forlorn Hope, purposely missing Hiei to strike the mirror, which caused the arrogant demon to believe Yusuke missed.

Yusuke's next mission is to earn a place as the apprentice to the renowned psychic Genkai. He battles his way through a tournament, as does Kuwabara. Kuwabara faces the demon Rando in the semifinal round, and Rando uses a technique to shrink him, and tortures him sadistically, angering Yusuke. Rando's powers are almost too much for Yusuke, but he attempts the shrinking technique again, not realizing the target must hear the chant for it to work. Since Yusuke got swamp algae in his ears during the fight, he doesn't hear the chant, and it rebounds on Rando, allowing Yusuke to defeat him.

After a month's training with Genkai, Yusuke returns home, only to be informed by Botan that demons known as the Four Saint Beasts are seeking to unleash their army on Earth, and to that end are sending insects that possess humans to make them uncontrollably violent. Kuwabara volunteers to go with him, and on arriving at the Beasts' castle, they are joined by Kurama and Hiei, who Koenma recruited with the promise of clearing their criminal records. They fight their way to the top of the castle, where Yusuke battles the powerful Suzaku. He expends his life energy to defeat Suzaku and save Keiko, who is under attack by people infected by the insects. Kuwabara gives some of his life energy to save Yusuke.

Yusuke receives an assignment to rescue the ice apparition Yukina. He goes with Botan and Kuwabara. Yukina is Hiei's twin sister, which neither she nor Kuwabara know about. Yusuke and Kuwabara fight their way through demons up to the Toguro brothers. With teamwork, Kuwabara and Yusuke defeat the Toguros. But it turns out the Toguros threw the fight, as they were secretly working for their nominal boss's rival. The younger Toguro then confronts Yusuke and reveals that the power that nearly overwhelmed Yusuke and Kuwabara when he was trying to lose was a fifth of his real strength. He issues an ultimatum: fight in the Dark Tournament, a brutal demon competition, or be summarily killed.

Dark Tournament

Over the next two months Yusuke trains with Master Genkai for the Dark Tournament. For the Tournament they have have teams. Yusuke's team consist of himself, Kuwabara, Hiei, Kurama, and Master Genkai as "The Masked Fighter" to create Team Urameshi. The first round they have to fight the team called the Jolly Devil Six. Yusuke won against Chu. In this fight the two finish the fight with a knife edge death match. In this type of match, Chu puts two knives into the floor and he and Yusuke put their feet in front of the knife. Whoever slipped first off the knife would lose and the winner could kill the loser. Fortunately for Chu, Yusuke doesn't kill him. The next round he along with Kuwabara and Genkai face M1, M2, and M3 in a 3 vs. 3 match. Yusuke, Kuwabara, and Genkai, as "The Masked Fighter" win. Yusuke had to skip the fourth round so Genkai can train him to face Younger Toguro. Genkai gave him the Spirit Wave Orb, which was most of her reiki (or spirit energy) in an orb.

Yusuke had to face an unbearable pain in order to absorb the orb. He was now prepared for the finals to face Younger Toguro. Genkai attempts to face Toguro but she is killed by him. With the last of her strength, she explains her connection to Younger Toguro. In a Dark Tournament 50 years ago Genkai and Younger Toguro were teammates. She explains that Younger Toguro was human, until he became a demon to keep his strength and be young.

She thens warns him not to become like Younger Toguro and then the fight begins. During their long battle Genkai possesses Pu, Yusuke's spirit beast, to tell Younger Toguro that in order to bring out Yusuke's full potential, he must kill Kuwabara, his best friend. He does so but Kuwabara was secretly alive. This brings out all of Yusuke's strength and he defeats Younger Toguro.

Chapter Black Saga

In this saga, Yusuke has to stop Shinobu Sensui. Sensui was a former Spirit Detective who was driven insane by the Chapter Black videotape, a tape with the cruelest things that humans have ever done. He wants to open a portal to Demon World so the demons can bring terror to people to punish them. But in order to defeat him, he must defeat the rest of the Sensui Seven. With help from Kurama, Hiei, and Kuwabara he fights Sensui. But he realizes he can't defeat Sensui. So he has Sensui kill him to awaken Kuwabara, Hiei, and Kurama's hidden potential.

But this wouldn't be the last time to we see Yusuke. His ancestral demon blood has resurrected him and he now has the power of an S-class demon. It was revealed that he is a Mazoku, or a descendant the Amazaku demons. His demon ancestor named Raizen had a baby with a human woman. Raizen made so when the stars reach a certain alignment, a descendant would become a demon if they were worthy of being resurrected. The first time Yusuke died, his potential awoke and so did his hidden spirit powers. Missions after wards, especially during his fight with the Younger Toguro, they helped awaken his demon blood

However, in the end, it was his death at the hands of Sensui that pushed his change over the edge and completely changed him, allowing demonic kinship symbols to emerge all over his body and pushes him to S class power. After this transformation, he fights Sensui in the Demon World. Even with his new demon energy he still cannot defeat Sensui, until he is then possessed by his ancestor Raizen to help control his new-found power. This causes Yusuke's body to transform yet again, gaining demonic eyes and long white hair, and bringing out his potential power, boosting him to upper S class demon power. As a result, Raizen, through Yusuke's body, kills Sensui which upsets Yusuke greatly. So much in fact, Yusuke wanted to track down Raizen over the ordeal, thinking that if he was to kill a human like Sensui, he should have been the one to make the decision, not his ancestor. Koenma informed him that the passage way to the living world and the demon world was closing. He presented Yusuke with a choice; stay in the demon world forever, or return to his home. Yusuke chose the latter in the end.

In the Three Kings saga, Yusuke is removed from his position as Spirit Detective because he is considered too dangerous for the Human Realm. The Great Emperor Enma (King Yama in the English anime) wants Yusuke dead so that he does not become as dangerous as Sensui. Even going to the home of former Spirit Detective Kuroko Sanada does not help much, since she partly agrees with Enma's judgment after Hokushin, Raizen's second-in-command shows up demanding that Yusuke come to the Demon Realm to help Raizen because Raizen is dying.

Three Kings Saga

Yusuke agrees to do so since Raizen interrupted his match against Sensui. He has everyone meet at Genkai's temple for a farewell and promises Keiko that he will return in three years time. After meeting Raizen, he learns that Raizen is dying because he needs to eat humans to survive, which he gave up after he met a female doctor who is Yusuke's ancestor. Yusuke fights him, but loses to him quite easily; then learns that Mukuro and Yomi are just as strong as the current, and weakened, Raizen.

After a year of training Yusuke, Raizen dies, but reveals to Yusuke that if he had eaten humans he would have already been the strongest ykai. Yusuke chooses to hold a tournament, since he knows he is incapable of ruling Raizen's territory. During his match against Yomi, Yusuke suddenly realizes he has lost his purpose, and questions why he is fighting. He used to fight because as a child, he had been angry and neglected, and took out his anger by fighting. Then he became a Spirit Detective and fought powerful men such as Toguro and Sensui to save the world, although they were actually looking for someone more powerful to defeat them.

Yusuke wonders whether he is now just waiting for someone to defeat him, now that his anger is gone and all he has is fighting, but Raizen's voices comes back and refreshes his mind. He remembers that he is fighting, not just to find his own identity, but for the sake of his friends as well. From this renewed strength, Yusuke discovers a new seikouki, and the fight between him and Yomi comes down to one punch. Rushing at each other, the fight would have been a tie, except that Yomi was able to continue standing because of an impromptu shout from Shura. Yusuke falls unconscious and doesn't awaken until after the tournament ends. After wards Yusuke leaves Makai shortly between the time after the tournament ends and before his three years are up.

Final Chapters

At the final chapters sometime after the end of the tournament, he opened a ramen booth and restarted his spirit detective business. Most of the work he received are getting signatures from friends of his that became famous idols.

Characteristics

Yusuke, at the beginning of the series, was a severe street fighting punk, and somewhat feared in his school district for never losing a fight. Even in the first chapter, he is shown easily taking on four people and beating them with utter ease, including Kuwabara, his rival, and someone who would later be one of his best friends. Despite the hard outer shell of a personality he proposed towards the start of Yu yu Hakusho, he was also revealed to have somewhat of a soft shell underneath, as he seemed to have a soft spot for Keiko Yukimura, his Junior High School crush. Among this and other things, he was also proven to be extremely kind simply because he sacrificed his life to save a child from a speeding car, causing him to have an alternative choice in what he wanted to do with his soul in the afterlife, rather than go to the River Styx, he would instead send himself on the path to becoming a Spirit Detective.

Powers and Abilities

Yusuke even as a 14 year old high school student was always a good fighter. He had gotten into so many street fights that he had accumulated a lot of experience. Yusuke's fighting style mainly revolves around brawling techniques and mostly relies on his fists. He noted at not using cheap moves and fights for the pure enjoyment he gets fighting. After his first death Yusuke began to learn about his spirit powers. He gained his intial powers though still had to outwit or get lucky with his opponents. Once he had his training under Genkai, Yusuke was able to match C-Class demons. During the Dark Tournament and after recieving the Spirit Wave Orb from Genkai, Yusuke was able to defeat an Upper B-Class Demon. After his second death while fighting Sensui, Yusukes dormant demon blooed woke up and he gained a further boost in power which was harnessed when he trained under the monks that guard his ancestor Raizen.

Signature Moves:

Spirit Gun: Yusuke extends his index finger and uses it as a focusing point to fire a blast of spirit energy. At first he was limited to a single shot a day and after his training under Genkai Yusuke gaing three more shots.

Spirit Gun Double: Yusuke fires two of his spirit gun bullets one right after another for a double punch.

Spirit Gun Mega: Yusuke uses all his shots into one massive blast that does an extreme amount of damage.

Demon Gun: Once Yusuke came back as a half breed demon he gained a large amount of demon energy which he started using instead of his spirit energy. The demon gun only runs out when Yusuke is out of demon energy.

Demon Gun Mega: Again Yusuke gathers a massive amount of energy for a single devastating attack.

Spirit Shotgun: Yusuke gathers his energy into his fist and fires a barrage of small energy blasts that spread over a large area.

Spirit Shotgun Double: Yusuke charges both his fists with energy and fires both blasts at the same time doubling the spread.

Spirit Punch: Yusuke infuses his spirit energy into his fists and feet to do more damage in close combat.

Spirit Wave: Genkai's trademarked move which uses your entire body as a focusing point for your spirit energy. This gives Yusuke a devastating close range attack that is usually delivered

Sacred Energy: Yusuke fuses his demon and spirit energies into one giving it a similar appearence to Sensui's sacred energy. It is harder to maintain and cannot be used for more than a couple of hours.

Power Sphere Fusion: Using the power sphere as a catalyst Yusuke, Kuwabara, Kurama, and Hiei fuses their souls into one and fire off this attack. First the blast is fire like Yusuke's Spirit Gun, then the blast whips back and forth like Kurama's Rose Whip, it then makes a direct hit like Kuwabara's Spirit Sword, then the energy is engulfed by Hiei's Dragon of the Darkness Flame giving it more destructive power.

Super Strength 200 tons

Tazmanian Devil

Worrior Taz
deck: Taz is an animated cartoon character featured in various Warner Bros. cartoons and comics. Taz is portrayed as a ferocious albeit dim-witted omnivore with a notoriously short temper. He is known for his tornado spinning ability and his really sharp teeth.
description:
Taz is the youngest out of all the Looney Tunes who only appeared in five Looney Tunes sketches before Warner Bros. Cartoons shut down in 1964 but appearing in marketing and television appearances and reaching a new popularity in the 1990's.

Creation and first appearance

Robert McKimson based the character on the real-life Tasmanian Devil, or more specifically its carnivorous nature and voracious appetite. Owen and Pemberton suggest that the character of the Tasmanian Devil was inspired by Errol Flynn. The most noticeable resemblance between the Australian marsupial and McKimson's creation is their ravenous appetites and crazed behavior. Although the bipedal Tasmanian Devil's appearance does not resemble its marsupial inspiration, it contains multilayered references to other "devils": he has horn-shaped fur on his head (similar to the Devil's appearance) and whirls about like a dust devil (similar in appearance to a tornado) which sounds like several motors whirring in unison. Taz is constantly voracious. His efforts to find more food (animate or inanimate) are always a central plot device of his cartoons.

In fact, this appetite serves as the impetus for McKimson's Devil May Hare (first released on June 19, 1954). In the short, Taz stalks Bugs Bunny, but due to his dimwittedness and inability to frame complete sentences, he serves as little more than a nuisance. Bugs eventually gets rid of him in the most logical way possible: matching him up with an equally insatiable female Tasmanian Devil.

The character's speech, peppered with growls, screeches, and raspberries, is provided by Mel Blanc. Only occasionally would Taz actually speak, usually to utter some incongruous punchline, (e.g. "What for you bury me in the cold, cold ground?") and yet the character is capable of writing and reading. A running gag is that when Bugs Bunny hears of the approach of "Taz" and looks him up in an encyclopedia and starts reading off a list of animals that "Taz" eats; Bugs finds "rabbits" not listed until "Taz" enters and either points out that "rabbits" are listed or writes rabbits on the list.

After the short entered theaters, producer Eddie Selzer, head of the Warner Bros. animation studio, ordered McKimson to shelve the character, feeling it was too violent for children and parents disliked this. After a time with no new Taz shorts, studio head Jack Warner asked what had happened to the character. Warner saved Taz's career when he told Selzer that he had received "boxes and boxes" of letters from people who liked the character and wanted to see more of him.

Later shorts

McKimson would go on to direct four more Tasmanian Devil cartoons, beginning with Bedeviled Rabbit (released on April 13, 1957). McKimson would also pair the Devil with Daffy Duck in Ducking the Devil (August 17, 1957) before pitting him once again against Bugs in Bill of Hare (June 9, 1962) and Dr. Devil and Mr. Hare (March 28, 1964). His last two appearances done by the classic Warner Brothers directors, writers, and voice actors were in Bugs Bunny's Looney Christmas Tales appearing in The Fright Before Christmas segment and at the very end eating the sleigh full of presents. Then he appeared in the 1983 movie Daffy Duck's Fantastic Island as Yosemite Sam's first mate.

The Tasmanian Devil appeared in "The Looney Tunes Show" episode "Devil Dog" voiced by Jim Cummings. In the show, he is portrayed walking on four legs like a real Tasmanian Devil and his eyes are bloodshot red (later turned yellow when Bugs uses a taming trick that Speedy Gonzales taught him). Initially, Bugs believed Taz to be a dog and kept him as a house pet, to his roommate, Daffy Duck's, discomfort. Eventually Bugs learned the truth and tried to return him to his home in Tasmania, only to find out that Taz would rather live with him, naming him "Poochie". Taz subsequently appears in the following episodes, "The Foghorn Leghorn Story", "Newspaper Thief", and "Bugs and Daffy Get A Job".

deck: Young, reckless and deadly, Stinger is a mutant with bio-electrical powers that she could release through her hands.
description:
Origin

Little is known about Stinger's past. Wendy Sherman originally hailed from San Fernando Valley in California. She was still a minor when Apocalypse found and recruited her. Quite young and very reckless, when she was recruited into the Alliance of Evil, and was their youngest member. She chose to wear bright colored clothes and bandannas with pink colored hair and a personality just as loud to match. On the battlefield, the last thing Stinger would inspire was fear in her foe. Like the other members of the Alliance of Evil, she opposed the Mutant Registration Act and would fight against it without question. She was relatively inexperienced in battle, as she would solely rely on her powers in combat. If anyone could get close enough to physically fight her hand-to-hand, then she could be easily disabled.

Creation

Stinger was created by Bob Layton and Jackson Guice in 1986 and first appeared in X-Factor # 5.

Mayor Story-arcs

Alliance of Evil

During battle with X-Factor, Michael Nowlan was forced to provide a power boost to the Alliance of Evil who were holding his estranged wife hostage. However, Stinger's powers flared out of control and she accidentally killed Susan Nowlan when she was trying to stun her.

Stinger also had a massive had a crush on Angel,and often annoyed him with her inane flirting during the fights with X-Factor and the X-Terminators.


Utopia

Although not seen for many years, Stinger took up the X-Men's offer for all mutants to join them on Utopia. While living there, she went to Iceman for advice. She was scared that while living there, Utopia would come under attack and all the mutants would die. She felt a connection with Iceman because he was a member of X-Factor whom she had fought while with the Alliance of Evil. However, he brushed her off.

Angered, Stinger took Dr Kavita Rao hostage in order to get a plane to get off the island. Iceman confronted her. He revealed that he remember her and that he liked her, even though she had been trying to kill him. Stinger broke down, agreeing to stay on Utopia and start a tentative friendship with Iceman.

Later during second coming, Stinger is one of the mutants that Cyclops gathered after the Dome is set on Utopia and the Nimrod's invade. He tells them to fight because today, they are all X-Men.


Powers and abilities

Stinger is a mutantwho can build, store and discharge bio-electricity from her hands. Most generally, Stinger would release her potent energies from her hands because it allowed more focus and aim. Though fairly new to her mutant power's she show the ability to use them in varying ways. She was able to discharge her stored energies in differing levels of energy. Stinger could discharge her bio-electrical energies as minuscule as small static, to staggering bolts of lightning like energy that could be devastating.

As part of the Alliance of Evil, Apocalypse would regularly have the member's of his group take large doses of the Source's mutant enhancement energies. As a result each of the member's including Stinger had massively increased strength. The negative to these actions is that Source's mutant powers of enhancement were very addictive. It would make the receiver crave/need the energies to survive. Stinger would definitely feel the ramifications of her addiction.

Statistics


  • Known Relatives: Unknown
  • Citizenship: Citizen of the United States. A minor, already with a criminal record.
  • Place of Birth: San Fernando, California
  • Marital Status: Single
  • Occupation: Currently unknown (former, Terrorist, Mutant Rights Activist and Mercenary).
  • Education: Unknown
  • Height: 5'3"
  • Weight: 110 lbs.
  • Eyes: Blue
  • Hair: Natural color unknown. Previously dyed Platinum blonde with pink streaks. Currently pale electric blue.

Alternate Realities

Earth-295: Age of Apocalypse

There was a young woman named Wendy that resided on Avalon. Both physically and in powers she resembled Stinger. Therefore it is unconfirmed, but presumed that this is an alternate version of Stinger. Wendy was mentally attacked and possessed by the Shadow King and used as a living weapon for him. Once she was completely under his thralls he used her power's against those she called her friends and dealt out serious damage to Avalon and those who lived there. She ravaged her surroundings doing serious damage, killing and injuring many until Mystique was forced to kill her. It was the only way to stop her uncontrollable rampage.

deck: Linda Danvers merged with Matrix (Supergirl) and became a hero.  After separation from Matrix, she became a hero in her right.
description:
Origin

Linda Danvers is the daughter of Fred Danvers and Sylvia Danvers. She had a boyfriend named Buzz who subjected her to many questionable activities. Buzz turned out to actually be a demon and planned to use Linda as a sacrifice in a demonic ritual. Matrix intervened and stopped Buzz, but he had already slashed Linda's wrists. Matrix attempted to heal Linda's wounds using her shape shifting abilities, but she ended up being bonded to the young girl and transformed her appearance. In order to repay her debt to Matrix for saving her life, she fought against demons as Supergirl.

Character Creation

Linda Danvers was created by Peter David.

Character Evolution

Linda Danvers was believed to have been retconned out of existence due to Superboy-Prime punching the walls of reality. However, Geoff Johns stated that Linda Danvers still existed, and that she made her return to the DCU in July of 2008. Linda has appeared in Reign in Hell, still being considered part angel despite having Matrix leave her before. She has been referenced as Supergirl in the mini-series, thus implying that her series remains in continuity.

Major Story Arcs

Being Supergirl

Linda gained vast abilities as Supergirl, and no one suspected she was Linda, because Linda was a short brunette whereas Supergirl was a tall blonde. Linda dedicated herself to fighting crime and demonic activity to make up for her past misdeeds. This was a confusing and eventful time for Linda; even more confusing, however, was the revelation that Matrix had become an Earth-Born Angel after rescuing Linda.

Lind Danvers' first appearance was in the 1996 self-titled Supergirl.

Being an Earth-Born Angel

When Linda became an Earth-Born Angel, she developed wings of fire and flame vision. She discovered that she could shunt (teleport) in a S-shaped burst of flame. She used her powers to fight demons and dark gods, and even a fellow Earth-Born Angel, Blithe. Supergirl later fought a being known as the Carnivore. During the battle, Matrix and Linda were ripped apart and Linda was alone again. She still had powers, but at lower level than she had when bonded with Matrix.

Another new start

After a long search, Linda found Matrix in the Amazon as a prisoner of the Demon Queen Lilith. Twilight, a New God, was blackmailed by the Demon Queen into guarding Matrix because she had her sister Jane as her prisoner. Linda fought with Twilight, but during the fight Jane was freed due to the damage their battle caused. Twilight, Jane, and Linda fought against Lilith and rescued Matrix, but during the battle, Twilight was fatally injured. Linda asked Matrix to bond with Twilight so she could save Twilight just as she had saved her. Twilight became the Angel of Fire and restored Linda's powers to their former levels before her separation from Matrix.

Meeting Kara Zor-El

When Linda Danvers arrives back in her hometown of Leesburg just as she is settling back in with her parents, they see something hurtling towards the center of town. Linda checks it out as Supergirl only to find another Supergirl. This Supergirl says she is Kara Zor-El. This so called new Supergirl claims to be a Kryptonian. Linda is not sure whether to believe her or not and as a result yells at the girl, causing her to flee.

Linda spends the next several days chasing after Kara. Since then, Linda finds Kara trying to push the world out of orbit so a meteor would not crash into it. Linda explains why she should not along with Superboy, so she stops. Later, Mr. Mxyzptlk is causing havoc at a parade, and Kara tries to stop him; as a result, she temporarily loses her powers and has to be saved by Superman. When she tries to explain who she is to him, he interrupts and tells her not to get involved thinking she's a crazed fan.

Kara becomes distraught and is taken to S.T.A.R. Labs by Linda and Superboy to find out if she is Kryptonian. The results were that she was a different 'breed' of Kryptonian. After this, Kara stays at Linda's house, and Linda decides to enroll Kara in the school where she is working. Eventually, they have an encounter with The Spectre, who says Kara's presence is disrupting the timeline, and that she must die so the universe can be saved. Kara is terrified and resists, but Linda calms Kara down and sent her away. While Kara is gone, Linda disguises herself and goes in place of Kara to the Pre-Crisis era, intending to die in her place.

Mrs. Superman

Linda arrived in the Pre-Crisis era at the feet of Superman on Earth-One. He asked her who she was and she came up with an elaborate story ,but Superman discovers who she really is. They had many adventures and Linda had been there three years doing what Kara would have done. Superman admits his love for Linda and the two of them get married and have a daughter together named Ariella.

The Sacrifice

Meanwhile, there is a villain called Xenon who has a vendetta against all Supergirls from all worlds because one imprisoned him at the dawn of time. He goes to the post-crisis era where he captures Kara. Back in the Pre-Crisis era, Linda was confronted by The Spectre saying that it was not going to work with Linda dying instead of Kara.Linda agreed to return to her time and send Kara back as long as The Spectre ensured that her daughter survives. The Specter agrees and Linda is transported to Xenons palace. Linda confronts Xenon, defeats him, and rescues Kara. Shortly thereafter, Linda and Kara are transported to the site of the Kara's rocket. Linda and Kara immediately understand what must be done, but Kara is still afraid and begs Linda for a way to save the universe without her having to die.

Linda deceives Kara by playing on Kara's trust and then incapacitates her. Linda lays Kara in her ship and Kara is returned to the pre-crisis era.

Retirement

Linda retired after she sacrificed Kara and was unable to bear the guilt. The Spectre saved Ariella but never brought her to Linda. Linda had one last reunion with her family and met her new baby brother "Wally" before leaving everyone and giving up the identity of Supergirl. She sent a letter to Lois and Clark Kent saying that she no longer felt worthy of being Supergirl.

Angel Again

In Reign in Hell, the Shadowpact found Linda Danvers living in obscurity in Gotham City. Due to her previous connection as Earth Angel of Fire,

they attacked her which she revealed that angelic flames powers had returned. Sporting flaming wings defends herself from the Shadowpact only to be shunted away to Hell for her previous "debts". Linda is later seen in the company of Dr. Occult after she is summoned and released by Lilith. During this encounter, her persona has seemed to changed to that of a vengeful fallen angel. On her journey with Dr. Occult, Linda mercilessly kills some injured demons with her flame vision. Afterward she confronts Dr. Occult on being a damned soul and proclaims she would burn every damned soul because she was being held prisoner in Hell. To help her regain her senses, Dr. Occult casts a spell to reveal to Linda who she really is and all the good deeds she did as Supergirl and she flies away in disgust and horror.

Powers and Abilities

Psychokinesis

Linda uses psychic abilities to emulate the powers of a Kryptonian. It allows her to have Super strength, speed, and endurance. It allows her to possess flight and makes her invulnerable against most conventional attacks.

Telekinesis

Along with her Psychokinesis Linda has the ability to affect space and matter around her. She can create force fields of psychic energy or she can turn it on the offensive and use psychic blasts against her enemies.

Invisibility

When she was bonded with Matrix she possessed the ability to render herself invisible, but once they were separated she lost this ability.

Shapeshifting

Since this was an ability possessed by Matrix, Linda was able to utilize it as well though it was mostly used by Linda to change into Matrix's form.

Angel Of Fire Abilities

When Linda was split from Matrix she became aware of her powers as an Earthborn Angel. She possessed wings of flame as well as fire vision. After Twilight bonded with Matrix and restored Linda's power levels to their former state she lost her Earthborn Angel abilities but she later regained these power's while trapped in Hell.

Alternate Realities

Supergirl: Wings

Linda Danvers is dark and gothic teenager, corrupted by a demon. She eventually merges with her guardian angel, Matrix, becoming some kind of Supergirl.

JLA: Created Equals

Fifteen years after all men are wipped from earth (Except Lex Luthor and Superman), Linda changes her name from Supergirl to Superwoman and she is realocated in Themyscira, the world new capitol.

JLA: Act of God

Linda is among the character that lost their powers due to a cosmic event that takes away the power from metahumans. She continues her duty as a hero, changing her name to Justice, and joining Martian Manhunter, Aquaman, Flash (Wally West) and Batman, forming the Phoenix Group.

Other Media

Television

Smallville

Kara, portrayed by Laura Vandervoort, takes the Linda Danvers alter ego in an alternate timeline where she was raised by the Luthors.

Games

Justice League Heroes

The Linda Danvers version of Supergirl is a playable character in the game. She is voiced by Tara Strong.

deck: Element Girl was a US secret agent who agreed to duplicate the accident that granted Metamorpho his powers. Her powers were granted by Ra, the sun god of Egypt.
description:
Not to be confused with the similar DC Comics character: Element Woman

Origin

Element Girl sought out Metamorpho after receiving her powers and the two had an attraction to each other probably based out of their shared "condition". In the end Metamorpho made it clear that he didn't want a relationship with her as he was already involved with another woman at the time and the two lost touch.

Creation

Element Girl was created by Metamorpho writer Bob Haney in Metamorpho #10.

The character was unheard of for decades before being revived by Neil Gaiman for an acclaimed single issue story in The Sandman.

Major Story Arcs

The Sandman

Element Girl was revived for a single issue of The Sandman in issue #20. It was revealed she had planned to throw herself into her work as a secret agent but her new metahuman condition made her too conspicuous and she lost her job. She sank into a depression and became completely isolated from the world as she now felt she was a freak. She tried to kill herself many times but her body keep adapting to every threat she aimed at herself.

Death of the Endless eventually noticed her plight and intervened. She told Element Girl that she couldn't take her life as she was granted immortality by Ra. She also revealed that Ra had given her powers and many others to battle the serpent god Apep. Ra was unaware Apep was already dead. Death tells Element Girl to look into the sun and ask Ra to remove her gifts. Element Girl dies and leaves behind a pile of ash with an expression of pure happiness.

Other Versions

Gaiman would once again write the character alongside artist Mike Allred in Metamorpho silver age themed adventures in Wednesday Comics.

A character named Element Woman was created for the new DC Universe.

deck: Scoop is a member of the G. I. Joe team.
description: U.S. Army Sergeant Leonard Michaels from Chicago, Illinois. Scoop has an advance degree in journalism and a masters degree in electrical engineering. He could have made a career with the network news, but decided he wanted to be there as the news was happening. After joining the Army, Scoop was assigned to the G.I. Joe team for a mission into Sierra Gordo. Scoop was to videotape the operation for the Defense Department. Scoop had never been out in the field and had no experience with any kind of combat situation. Some of the small team of Joes resented Scoop at first, seeing him as a liability and a distraction. The Joes were to ambush an Iron Grenadier convoy in the Sierra Gordo jungles, and despite his duties as a journalist, Scoop was given the task of keeping Tunnel Rat's ammunition coming as he fired his heavy machine gun. In the chaotic battle in the jungle, Tunnel Rat was knocked out, leaving the mostly unarmed Scoop to fight with a Grenadier. In the end, to save himself and Tunnel Rat, he smashed his video camera into the Grenadiers head before passing out himself. When he came to, in the Joes' extraction helicopter, the others were impressed that he destroyed all of his video footage for the sake of the team and the mission. Scoop would return to Sierra Gordo some time later on a mission to rescue Joes and members of the October Guard being held by rebel troops. Scoop served with the Joes on many other occasions before the team was shut down in 1994. Some time after the G.I. Joe team was reinstated, Scoop again worked with the team.
